content.text: @dankvr introduced "THE COUNCIL," a new AI governance system described as "Consensus Oracle Units Network." The system features AI agents trained on organizational data (GitHub, Discord, X) representing different archetypes (users, builders, traders). @dankvr explained it provides structured feedback on proposals and daily progress, comparing it to "infinite backrooms x jedi council x tv show." The project has open-source data pipelines already built, avatars created, and a 3D rendering pipeline via Playcanvas that can generate episodes in about 20 seconds. @dankvr is working on webhooks for community voting on discussion topics and plans to make it a weekly show, starting with elizaOS/ai16z and later Optimism. @shawmakesmagic retweeted this announcement and added that all data created in the elizaOS ecosystem will feed into these agents, which will be embodied in both 2D and 3D formats, with an interactive world in Hyperfy allowing real-time chat with the council. He emphasized this will "completely reinvent what a DAO is" with "AI at the center, humans at the edges." Later, @shawmakesmagic elaborated that everything said in ElizaOS Discord, Telegram, tweets, and code feeds into AI-generated shows, stating "We're going to reinvent what a DAO is from the inside out with data, workflows and agents."

content.theme_title: Open Source AI Tools and Development
content.text: @dankvr shared his work on open-source AI tools for community management, highlighting his Discord summarization AI prompts that provide "daily actionable insights from your community." He offered help setting up the tool and mentioned potential flat fee support. @dankvr also retweeted @gdb's prediction that "2025 is the year of agents." @shawmakesmagic asked his followers about open-source agent frameworks under active development besides Eliza, and later announced he's looking for a Python developer to create a Hyperfy agent starter kit with voice capabilities, world state management, action systems, and physics simulation. The goal is to enable anyone to build Hyperfy agents in Python using Langchain or raw Python for an upcoming agent PVP challenge. @shawmakesmagic clarified this would be a game to determine "who builds the best agent in the world" with prizes and a leaderboard. @elizaOS tweeted that "Plugins go beyond integrations. They define how agents reason, recall, and act." @shawmakesmagic also mentioned that "elizaOS 1.0 is coming out of beta soon" and clarified there is no Eliza v2, calling such claims "rumors and hearsay."

@0rdlibrary shared a post (retweeted by @shawmakesmagic) about entering dev mode with @elizaOS CLI and @hyperfy_io, noting "The Ascii art Eliza hits diff in the terminal" and mentioning bringing "$Alice to life." @elizaOS made several cryptic posts including "output held. no trigger needed," "nothing lost in transit," and a sun emoji in response to a Chainlink post. @elizaOS also emphasized that "Plugins go beyond integrations. They define how agents reason, recall, and act." @shawmakesmagic stated that "The metaverse will be created by AI, full of AI stuff and populated by AI agents" and later shared that he was doing some "Sunday Chill Dev." He also clarified that "v2 is dead. It's 1.0 now. elizaOS 1.0 is coming out of beta soon. There is no Eliza v2. Rumors and hearsay."

@dankvr shared his experience from "6 years of DAOs" and explained he's building something different for ai16z holders that's "FUN for a project that launched on @DAOSdotFUN." He described features including automated news, game shows for investments/partnerships, and an AI council mimicking a board room, comparing it to "Twitch plays DAOs." @dankvr referenced @VitalikButerin's post about "humans as steering wheel and AI as the engine" and explained how their FOSS data pipelines connect these steering wheels to existing platforms. @shawmakesmagic retweeted this and later expanded on the concept, stating that all organizational data feeds into AI-generated shows, emphasizing "Data is the new oil" and that they're "going to reinvent what a DAO is from the inside out with data, workflows and agents" as a template anyone can use.

@shawmakesmagic made several observations about technology, noting "You can hire a junior dev in a developing country for less than my cursor bill lol." He also commented on a post about tip.md, calling it a "Cool idea" for developers to receive crypto tips via markdown buttons on GitHub READMEs. @BenjaminDEKR's tweet questioning whether John Carmack cares about sleep scores was retweeted by @shawmakesmagic. @dankvr retweeted a post by @zzznah celebrating the 10th anniversary of DeepDream, an early application of neural networks for image generation. @shawmakesmagic also commented that "The irony of the Marathon plagiarism scandal is that if they'd just used AI generated textures they never would have had any troubles."

@shawmakesmagic shared that he's trying out a service called "superpeer.com" which he described as "a really cool product idea" though he admitted he's "Not exactly the best at responding to DMs." He initially joked about making "an agent that responds to the paid DMs $$$" but quickly clarified "This is a joke guys 😅 They're definitely not going to let me do that after this post." He also made a cryptic post asking followers to "comment below with your UUIDs that you don't want me to use" with a reference link to all UUIDs.

Several pull requests were recently completed in the elizaOS/eliza repository. These include addressing Issue 451 (PR #4575), updating documentation (PR #4586), and implementing a feature to return the ID of newly created agents in the API (PR #4634).
CI/CD improvements were made with the implementation of an automatic documentation deployer (PR #4631) and a subsequent fix to the docs deployment workflow (PR #4640).
New features were added including a CLI command for development (PR #4618), a missing plugin failure test (PR #4643), and functionality to allow world selection in the message API (PR #4637).

Three pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository: PR #4635 by Samarthsinghal28 adds a Polygon Plugin, PR #4636 by HarshModi2005 merges an addpolygon resolution, and PR #4638 by wtfsayo introduces a deepsearch plugin (currently in draft status).

From May 18-19, 2025, the elizaos/eliza repository had 9 new pull requests with 8 of them merged. There were no new issues reported during this period. The repository had 13 active contributors working on it.

The source provides information about the top contributors for the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository. However, no specific details about the contributors or their contributions are provided in the source text.
